br.dev.rplus.finv

Class Finv

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.dev.rplus.finv.Finv

  • public class Finv
extends java.lang.Object
    The FInv library (Finance Invest) is a software library that provides functions for financial analysis and investments in the Brazilian stock market, being a simple and powerful library that facilitates the development of investment applications, providing functions ready to consult, calculate and visualize financial indicators.
    Version:
    1.0.2
    Author:
    Rafael Camargo

        Parameters:
        ticker - the ticker symbol of the stock
        events - a list of events associated with the stock

        endDateStr - the end date of the stock data in string format
        Returns:
        the Stock object retrieved based on the given parameters

      • get

        public static Stock get(java.lang.String ticker,
                        java.util.List<Event> events,
                        java.lang.String startDate,
                        java.lang.String endDate,
                        Frequency frequency)
        Retrieves a stock object with the specified ticker symbol, along with additional events if provided.
        Parameters:
        ticker - the ticker symbol of the stock to retrieve
        events - a list of events to include in the stock object (e.g., history, dividends, split)
        startDate - the start date of the events range in string format
        endDate - the end date of the events range in string format
        frequency - the frequency at which to retrieve the events (e.g., daily, weekly, monthly)
        Returns:
        the stock object with the specified ticker and events

        public static double stats(Stock stock,
                           Stats stats)
        Calculates the statistics for a given stock using the provided stock and stats objects.
        Parameters:
        stock - the stock object containing the stock information
        stats - the stats object containing the statistical calculations to be performed
        Returns:
        the calculated statistics for the stock

      • stats

        Parameters:
